title: Concept: Min-Heap vs Max-Heap
content: A Heap is a binary tree where every parent is smaller (Min-Heap) or larger (Max-Heap) than its children. Root is always O(1) access. Insert/Pop is O(log N).

title: Concept: Two Heaps Pattern
content: To track the Median of a stream, maintain two heaps: a Max-Heap for the lower half and a Min-Heap for the upper half. Balance them so size diff is at most 1.

title: Concept: Merging Intervals
content: Always sort intervals by Start Time first. Then iterate: if current.start < previous.end, they overlap. Extend previous.end = max(previous.end, current.end).

title: Concept: Sweep Line
content: Decompose intervals into events (Time, +1) for start and (Time, -1) for end. Sort events by time. Iterate to track 'active' intervals count.

title: Concept: Greedy Interval Scheduling
content: To max non-overlapping intervals, sort by End Time. Always pick the interval that ends earliest (and is valid) to leave max room for future intervals.
